3.1.1.title: Limit system access to authorized users
3.1.1.description: Limit information system access to authorized users, processes acting on behalf of authorized users, or devices (including other information systems).

3.1.2.title: Limit system access to permitted transactions and functions
3.1.2.description: Limit information system access to the types of transactions and functions that authorized users are permitted to execute.

3.1.3.title: Control flow of CUI
3.1.3.description: Control the flow of CUI in accordance with approved authorizations.

3.1.4.title: Separate duties of individuals
3.1.4.description: Separate the duties of individuals to reduce the risk of malevolent activity without collusion.

3.1.5.title: Employ least privilege
3.1.5.description: Employ the principle of least privilege, including for specific security functions and privileged accounts.

3.2.1.title: Ensure personnel are trained
3.2.1.description: Ensure that managers, systems administrators, and users of organizational information systems are made aware of the security risks associated with their activities.

3.2.2.title: Provide awareness training on recognizing threats
3.2.2.description: Ensure that organizational personnel are adequately trained to carry out their assigned information security-related duties and responsibilities.

3.3.1.title: Create and retain audit logs
3.3.1.description: Create and retain system audit logs and records to the extent needed to enable the monitoring, analysis, investigation, and reporting of unlawful or unauthorized system activity.

3.3.2.title: Ensure audit logs capture key events
3.3.2.description: Ensure that the actions of individual system users can be uniquely traced to those users so they can be held accountable for their actions.

3.3.4.title: Alert on audit logging failures
3.3.4.description: Alert in the event of an audit logging process failure.

3.3.5.title: Correlate audit log review
3.3.5.description: Correlate audit record review, analysis, and reporting processes for investigation and response to indications of unlawful, unauthorized, suspicious, or unusual activity.

3.3.6.title: Provide audit record reduction
3.3.6.description: Provide audit record reduction and report generation to support on-demand analysis and reporting.

3.3.7.title: Provide time-synchronized audit logs
3.3.7.description: Provide a system capability that compares and synchronizes internal system clocks with an authoritative source to generate time stamps for audit records.

3.3.8.title: Protect audit information
3.3.8.description: Protect audit information and audit logging tools from unauthorized access, modification, and deletion.

3.3.9.title: Limit audit log management
3.3.9.description: Limit management of audit logging functionality to a subset of privileged users.

3.4.1.title: Establish configuration baselines
3.4.1.description: Establish and maintain baseline configurations and inventories of organizational systems throughout the respective system development life cycles.

3.4.2.title: Establish configuration change control
3.4.2.description: Establish and enforce security configuration settings for information technology products employed in organizational systems.

3.5.1.title: Identify system users and devices
3.5.1.description: Identify system users, processes acting on behalf of users, and devices.

3.5.2.title: Authenticate users and devices
3.5.2.description: Authenticate (or verify) the identities of users, processes, or devices, as a prerequisite to allowing access to organizational systems.

3.5.3.title: Use multifactor authentication
3.5.3.description: Use multifactor authentication for local and network access to privileged accounts and for network access to non-privileged accounts.

3.6.1.title: Establish incident response capability
3.6.1.description: Establish an operational incident-handling capability for organizational systems that includes preparation, detection, analysis, containment, recovery, and user response activities.

3.6.2.title: Track and report incidents
3.6.2.description: Track, document, and report incidents to designated officials and/or authorities both internal and external to the organization.

3.7.2.title: Control maintenance tools
3.7.2.description: Provide controls on the tools, techniques, mechanisms, and personnel used to conduct system maintenance.

3.8.1.title: Protect media containing CUI
3.8.1.description: Protect (i.e., physically control and securely store) system media containing CUI, both paper and digital.

3.8.2.title: Limit access to CUI media
3.8.2.description: Limit access to CUI on system media to authorized users.

3.8.3.title: Sanitize media before disposal
3.8.3.description: Sanitize or destroy system media containing CUI before disposal or release for reuse.

3.9.1.title: Screen personnel
3.9.1.description: Screen individuals prior to authorizing access to organizational systems containing CUI.

3.9.2.title: Protect CUI during personnel actions
3.9.2.description: Ensure that organizational systems containing CUI are protected during and after personnel actions such as terminations and transfers.

3.10.1.title: Limit physical access
3.10.1.description: Limit physical access to organizational systems, equipment, and the respective operating environments to authorized individuals.

3.10.2.title: Protect and monitor physical access
3.10.2.description: Protect and monitor the physical facility and support infrastructure for organizational systems.

3.11.1.title: Periodically assess risk
3.11.1.description: Periodically assess the risk to organizational operations, organizational assets, and individuals resulting from the operation of organizational systems and the associated processing, storage, or transmission of CUI.

3.11.2.title: Scan for vulnerabilities
3.11.2.description: Scan for vulnerabilities in organizational systems and applications periodically and when new vulnerabilities affecting those systems and applications are identified.

3.11.3.title: Remediate vulnerabilities
3.11.3.description: Remediate vulnerabilities in accordance with risk assessments.

3.12.1.title: Periodically assess security controls
3.12.1.description: Periodically assess the security controls in organizational systems to determine if the controls are effective in their application.

3.12.2.title: Develop security plans
3.12.2.description: Develop and implement plans of action designed to correct deficiencies and reduce or eliminate vulnerabilities in organizational systems.

3.12.3.title: Monitor security controls
3.12.3.description: Monitor security controls on an ongoing basis to ensure the continued effectiveness of the controls.

3.13.1.title: Monitor and control communications at boundaries
3.13.1.description: Monitor, control, and protect communications at the external boundaries and key internal boundaries of organizational systems.

3.13.2.title: Use architectural designs to promote security
3.13.2.description: Employ architectural designs, software development techniques, and systems engineering principles that promote effective information security within organizational systems.

3.13.5.title: Implement subnetworks
3.13.5.description: Implement subnetworks for publicly accessible system components that are physically or logically separated from internal networks.

3.13.8.title: Implement cryptographic mechanisms
3.13.8.description: Implement cryptographic mechanisms to prevent unauthorized disclosure of CUI during transmission unless otherwise protected by alternative physical safeguards.

3.13.11.title: Employ FIPS-validated cryptography
3.13.11.description: Employ FIPS-validated cryptography when used to protect the confidentiality of CUI.

3.14.1.title: Identify and manage flaws
3.14.1.description: Identify, report, and correct system flaws in a timely manner.

3.14.2.title: Provide protection from malicious code
3.14.2.description: Provide protection from malicious code at designated locations within organizational systems.

3.14.3.title: Monitor system security alerts
3.14.3.description: Monitor system security alerts and advisories and take action in response.
